D1.label: Data Centre Mega-Trend Winner
D1.description: Goodman Group executes on growth strategy; earnings accelerate
D1.plain_english: Goodman's 5.0 GW power bank, hyperscaler relationships, and global development capability position it as a primary beneficiary of the multi-decade data centre buildout. Revenue and earnings growth accelerate as DC projects move from development to recurring income. The platform attracts institutional capital at scale, compounding AUM growth.
D1.what_to_watch: Next earnings result and forward guidance.
D1.upside: Material re-rating if execution surprises to the upside.
D1.risk_plain: If growth disappoints, this narrative weakens.

D2.label: Solid Execution but Priced In
D2.description: Goodman Group delivers steady-state results; valuation holds
D2.plain_english: Goodman is executing well but the data centre premium is fully reflected in the 36.2x trailing P/E and 3.3x price-to-book. The stock delivers market returns but not alpha from here. Growth is visible but priced; distribution yield of 0.5% offers no downside cushion.
D2.risk_plain: If the base case is already priced in, limited upside from here.

D3.label: Data Centre Bubble Risk
D3.description: Goodman Group faces headwinds; earnings or multiples compress
D3.plain_english: Hyperscaler capex decelerates or reverses. Data centre supply exceeds demand as multiple developers flood the market simultaneously. Power constraints become binding. Goodman's DC pipeline faces delays or cancellations.
D3.what_to_watch: Cost pressures, competitive threats, or macro headwinds.
D3.risk_plain: Material downside if multiple risks crystallise simultaneously.

D4.label: Platform Transformation to Infrastructure Manager
D4.description: A structural shift changes the investment case for Goodman Group
D4.plain_english: Goodman evolves from a traditional REIT into a global infrastructure asset manager. The fund management platform (A$72B external AUM) becomes the primary earnings driver as fees on DC assets compound. Operating leverage emerges: A$86B AUM managed by ~1,030 employees (A$83M per head) is among the most capital-efficient in global real estate.
D4.what_to_watch: Industry disruption signals and regulatory changes.
D4.upside: See research report for upside scenario detail.
D4.risk_plain: If disruption materialises, prior assumptions become invalid.

big_picture: Goodman is executing a generational transformation from industrial REIT to global data centre infrastructure platform. The 5.0 GW power bank across 13 cities is a moat that cannot be replicated quickly. A$12.9B in development WIP (57% data centres, rising to 75% by FY26) is 94% pre-committed to hyperscalers. CPP Investments' A$14B European DC partnership validates the platform at institutional scale. Operating EPS grew 9.8% to 118.0 cents with FY26 guidance for further 9% growth. At 36.2x trailing P/E (23.7x forward), the market is paying a premium but the earnings visibility is exceptional.
